title: Authors and Citation
text: Lenormand M (2023). EpiVec: Vector-borne Epidemics R. https://github.com/EpiVec/EpiVec, https://epivec.github.io/EpiVec/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {EpiVec: Vector-borne Epidemics in R},   author = {Maxime Lenormand},   year = {2023},   note = {https://github.com/EpiVec/EpiVec, https://epivec.github.io/EpiVec/}, }

title: Vector-borne Epidemics in R
text: package EpiVec can installed following command line R session:

what: Create a contingency table from a data.frame — net_to_mat
title: Create a contingency table from a data.frame — net_to_mat
text: function creates contingency table two- three-columns data.frame row represents interaction two nodes (site species example) optional third column indicating weight interaction (weight = TRUE).

title: Create a contingency table from a data.frame — net_to_mat
code: net_to_mat(   net,   weight = FALSE,   squared = FALSE,   symmetrical = FALSE,   missing_value = 0 )

title: Create a contingency table from a data.frame — net_to_mat
text: net two- three-columns data.frame row represents interaction two nodes (site species example) optional third column indicating weight interaction. weight boolean indicating weight considered squared boolean indicating output matrix squared (nodes rows columns). symmetrical boolean indicating resulting matrix symmetrical (squared = TRUE). Note different weights associated two opposite pairs already present net preserved. missing_value value assign pairs nodes present net (0 default).

title: Create a contingency table from a data.frame — net_to_mat
text: matrix first nodes (first column net) rows second nodes (second column net) columns. Note squared = TRUE rows columns number elements corresponding concatenation unique objects net's first second columns. squared = TRUE matrix can forced symmetrical based upper triangular part matrix.

title: Create a contingency table from a data.frame — net_to_mat
text: Maxime Lenormand (maxime.lenormand@inrae.fr), Pierre Denelle (pierre.denelle@gmail.com) Boris Leroy (leroy.boris@gmail.com)

title: Create a contingency table from a data.frame — net_to_mat
code: if (FALSE) { net <- data.frame(   Site = c(rep("A", 2), rep("B", 3), rep("C", 2)),   Species = c("a", "b", "a", "c", "d", "b", "d"),   Weight = c(10, 100, 1, 20, 50, 10, 20) )  mat <- net_to_mat(net, weight = TRUE) }
